newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy govt plans confidence vote on Banco di Napoli.
newsitem.headline: Italy govt plans confidence vote on Banco di Napoli.

text.p: Italy's centre-left government intends to seek a vote of confidence in the lower house of parliament to enable passage into law of a cabinet decree on a rescue plan for Banco di Napoli, a senior member of parliament for the governing alliance said on Tuesday.
Lanfranco Turci, economic affairs expert of the Democratic Party of the Left, said the decision to seek a confidence vote was likely to be taken by a cabinet meeting due to start at 1700 GMT.
Passage of the decree is being threatened by 1,000 amendments submitted by the separatist Northern League party.

The decree is due to expire on November 24 unless it has been passed into law by then and could not be resubmitted as a result of a Constitutional Court ruling banning the practice of successive cabinets of re-issuing expiring decrees.
Turci said the government could inform parliament that it was presenting a confidence vote later on Tuesday or on Wednesday, meaning it would be debated later this week.
Passage of a confidence vote has the effect of sweeping away amendments to a bill. Defeat on the vote would bring down the government.
